key_points: Colonial Pipeline experienced a cyberattack, halting operations on May 7.
Main lines remain non-operational as of May 10, but some smaller lines are functioning.
The company plans to restore service by the end of the week.
Colonial Pipeline is a major fuel delivery system, spanning 5,500 miles, from the U.S. Gulf Coast to the East Coast.
It transports fuels such as gasoline, diesel, heating oil, and jet fuel, critical for the southeastern U.S.
The Southeast will rely on inventory and alternative sources like the 720,000 b/d Products (SE) Pipeline in the meantime.
Pipeline flow is slow, meaning some areas may depend on inventories for days post-restoration.
Atlantic Coast markets have options for imports and marine shipments for additional supplies.
Central Atlantic and Northeast markets can import fuel from Europe, Canada, or use in-region refineries.
Regulatory waivers have been issued to ease trucking restrictions for petroleum product delivery across 17 states and D.C.
